data.title: Ostersunds FK vs Arsenal player ratings as Mesut Ozil shines on his return to the Europa League
data.meta_description: Ozil was with Werder Bremen when he last played on a Thursday night, but he ran the show against the Swedish side
data.text:
Arsenal made short work of Swedish side Ostersund to have one foot in the Europa League's last 16.

And it was a man who hasn't appeared in the competition for EIGHT years who did the damage in snowy Scaninavia.

Mesut Ozil was with Werder Bremen when he last played on a Thursday night, but he helped make short work of Graham Potter's men.

Nacho Monreal and an own goal made it comfortable, before the German got in on the act with the third.

With a penalty save to boot, here's how they rated...

Ospina 8

A freezing spectator before Ghoddos warmed him up - plus a penalty stop

Bellerin 7

Bailed out by Ospina after giving away late penalty with poor challenge

Chambers 7

Allowed Ghoddos two sights of goal but made key blocks too

Mustafi 7

Involved in penalty scare but otherwise strolled through the game

Monreal 8 (Kolasinac 73)

In the right place at the right time again with third goal in six games

Elneny 7

Won't be the toughest game he has trying to shield defence

Maitland-Niles 7

In his preferred central midfield position and kept things safe and simple

Iwobi 6

Shot led to opener. With better passing could have been more productive

Ozil 8

MOTM. Not at full tilt and didn't need to be to dictate game and score

Mkhitaryan 7 (Nelson 84)

Unlucky not to open his Arsenal account but did set up two more goals

Welbeck 5 (Nketiah 83)

Handed very rare chance up front and failed to take it. Frustrating.

Subs not used: Xhaka, Macey, Willock, Holding

Ostersund

Keita 5; Mukiibi 6, Papagiannopoulos 4, Petterson 6, Widgren 5 (Widgren 73); Edwards 6, Nouri 6 (Hopcutt 46, 6), Mensah 6; Sema 7, Ghoddos 7, Gero 6 (Tekie 46, 6). Unused: Andersson, Aiesh, Sonko Sundberg, Islamovic.
